columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the annual cash flow if we put up $41,000 today in exchange for a 5.1% and a 15-year annuity.

The annual cash flow refers to the stream of cash each period calculated based on the rate of return. We will consider the following details in determining the yearly cash flow.

| Particulars    |          |
|----------------|----------|
| Presert value  | $41,000  |
| Interest rate  | 5.1%     |
| Annuity period | 15       |

We will use the spreadsheet function PMT to calculate the annual cash flow. Hence in calculating the annual cash flow, we will use the following PMT spreadsheet function:

$$\begin{aligned}
PMT&=(\text{rate},nper,pv,[fv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PMT$, which presents the annual cash flows\
$nper$, which refers to the period\
$pv$, which represent the present value\
$fv$, the future value\
$type$, which indicates the basis of the calculation, either year-end (0) or beginning of the year (1)

In our calculation, we will consider the $41,000 as the present value (PV), the rate of 5.1%, and the period (nper) is the 15-year annuity. The future value [FV] is zero since there are no future values provided, and the [type] is set to zero as it symbolizes our calculation is on the end of the year basis.

Let's now determine the annual cash flow.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/db6f6f81-42e7-4c7e-8440-000fdc35d6e6-1640808890736395.png)
\
**Based on the calculation, the annual cash flow will be $3,976.78**
